page.title: 07CHURCH RUINS AND GRAVEYARD
page.content: Beside Carrick Lake we find the ruins of Carrick Lake Chapel and graveyard, dating from around the 1400's.A modern writer tells us that it measured 60ft by 18ft inside.Only parts of the two gables remain.It seems to have been a private Chapel of the ruling family, before the Ulster Plantation.It may have existed as a place of worship for the local Catholic people until penal times. Since then the Church has fallen into ruin but the graveyard itself is badly kept and the tombstones are difficult to read.Some appear to be buried.The oldest inscriptions on the headstones, which are standing, date back to 1742.
